name: Albergo Marina

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful B&B, great bang for the buck! Ernaldo was super friendly, his wife and daughter are great too. The breakfast and afternoon snack were wonderful. Tied for best room of the trip. Didn't have the views but made up for it with quality of the rooms. Lemon garden was great!
reviews.title: Nice rooms, super friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights in the middle of our trip to Italy. It was such a nice place and a beautiful place to be! We were there in April so the touristy season hadn't started up much. There weren't many other people there with us. The lemon garden was not open when we were there but we could walk out there and it seems like it would be pretty in the summer. The hotel staff was nice and friendly and the breakfast and lunch buffet were great! The room was pretty big by Italian standards so was the bathroom. It was quiet and comfortable too. It was great to be in the old part of the city. It felt like real Italy, not the touristy part. Albergo Marina is very close to the restaurants and shopping. A bit of a walk from the train station but very doable, even with suitcases.
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.text: We just returned from 4 nights in Monterosso and must say that this is a nice little Hotel. The owner ( Eraldo ) is the nicest man you will ever meet, the hotel is clean and the rooms are comfortable in the old part of Monterosso but close to everything. They have free luggage and 1 person pick up from the train station, afternoon snacks, cappuccino any time of day and as much as you want, a good breakfast with eggs if wanted ,made by Alessandro who is very nice and works hard. Eraldo recommende a nice Pizza place down the road which makes perfect pizzas and calzone and wont break the bank. It's very close to the beach where you can fo for drinks overlooking the sea, and they even give munchies with your drink. All in all a very good time in Monterosso, and if you go there say hello to Eraldo for me, from (Luigi from Canada).
reviews.title: Good Hotel To Stay At

reviews.text: Very rude American girl at the service desk. Our room and bathroom were full of black mold. I would never stay here again.
reviews.title: pass on this one

reviews.text: Great location, quiet, clean, staff friendly and very helpful. Stayed here 6 nights end of September. Three women travelling together - our room was generously sized, beds comfortable, buffet breakfast and afternoon snack satisfying.
reviews.title: Would stay here again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are a lot more hotels and rooms for rent in Monterosso than you would think from simply booking on the internet. Having said that, I think we got a pretty good deal on this one: 115 Euro per night plus a 10% discount for paying in cash and presenting the Rick Steves Cinque Terre book.
reviews.title: Excellent value in the heart of the old town

reviews.text: The price included a pretty good buffet breakfast in the lemon garden, which consisted of various coffees (automatic machine, decent coffee), teas, juices, cereals, yoghurts, various pastries, breads, nutella, jam, eggs to order (usually omelette but you could order bacon and eggs or waffles as well). Basically, anything you could want. It certainly was far better than the breakfast we decided to try at one of the local breakfast places. Aside from breakfast, the hotel puts on a free afternoon spread for guests, usually consisting of a pasta, a risotto, some salamis, and some fruits. It’s not as good as the breakfast, but it’s free and if you’re on a budget, you could subsist on this for lunch.
reviews.title: Love Monterosso!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was spot on – in the old town on a side street off the main street in the old town (centro storico). It was a bit of a walk to the train station (about 10 minutes) but at least there were no steps involved once out of the station. Plenty of people rolling luggage around, so no need to feel out of place.
reviews.title: Bella Italiano

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front desk staff spoke a reasonable amount of English, so it was easy enough to be understood. Internet was available from the lobby (no wireless). There was a sign that said 1 euro for 15 minutes, but we got it for free. In any case, it was cheaper than the local net cafe.
reviews.title: Quaint & Comfy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself was a double overlooking the main street. The windows opened out so you could lean out and take photos of the street, and as a bonus there was a clothesline outside the window you could use. Which was handy because the local laundromat is quite pricey (note the hotel doesn’t have an iron, but the laundromat does ironing for a fee of about 5 euro a piece). The bed was quite soft and comfortable, but not so good for bad backs. The first couple of nights were OK, but I got a sore back after that. Pillows were good though. As with most European hotels, the double was actually two singles made up as one bed. The room was quite spacious, about 7x3m, plus bathroom.
reviews.title: What a great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Albergo Marina
reviews.title: Great location - definitely recommend

reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights in July 2009.
reviews.title: Lovely place, would definitely go back
Hospitality plus
reviews.text: Location: excellent, 5 minute walk to the smaller beach (I didn’t think it was as nice as the one slightly farther out), and only 10 minutes to the main beach (we liked this one better, it gets crowded). Tons of restaurants within a few minutes walking distance of the hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms/amenities: room décor was nice, spacious, TV, AC, larger bathroom (we booked a superior room). Free beach towels to use which they change daily. Good buffet breakfast (they’ll make omelet to order), but the best part was the afternoon buffet, it was fantastic! Tons of fresh fruit, pastas, wine, etc.
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Suggestions: lots of good eating options in Monterosso. We ate twice at Ristorante Miky. We thought the food was fantastic. It’s definitely expensive, in our opinion you could probably get similar quality for the fish dishes elsewhere (there was another restaurant we really like but can’t remember the name unfortunately), but the pastas and appetizers at Miky are fantastic. Order the gnocchi and ask them to bake the flat bread on top. There is also a place nearby that offers free tastings of wine/liquor/preserves, etc. We bought the limoncello, it was the best we had (better than the ones we tried in southern Italy), and my parents who are Italian loved it as well.
reviews.title: Clean and friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Albergo Marina was a bit less than we hoped for, though there are not so many choices in Monterosso. The hotel was reasonably clean and the room was OK. It was reasonably priced. If we visit the Cinque Terre again, we would stay in Vernazza.
reviews.title: Just OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was in a perfect location in old Monterosso, which is the much much quainter side of Monterosso. So helpful, everything we needed, they took care of. Really nice room, very large for Europe. Clean, nice bathrooms. Nothing bad I can say about this hotel. They even have kayaks and bikes for your use while there. Their breakfast was simple but good. Best was that from 2-7 every day they have a free buffet including wine. You can eat it in the hotel dining room or take it up to the terraced lemon garden, which is about 5 levels and very quaint. This is not a hotel with an ocean view, very few in Monterosso are, but we absolutely loved it. Perfect location in the town, lots of cute restaurants, wine bars, shops right near. Stay here!
reviews.title: Amazing hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Albergo Marina at the end of Sept. for 3 nights. We chose this hotel after discovering that our first choice was booked and from reading reviews on tripadvisor. I'd have to say that we were pleasantly surprised with our accommodations and glad that our first choice was taken. We found this location to be better and we enjoyed our stay. The staff is friendly and the room was larger than we expected. Breakfast and afternoon snacks were a welcome addition to the services provided. We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great find.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We defintiely got lucky b/c we got the room day of. Most everywhere was booked, but we lucked out. We asked for a double and I THINK we got a triple (pull out). But the room was large, bright, decorated, and had a safe.
reviews.title: Super legit. Friendly staff. Great room. Great price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hosts were super friendly and informative. They offered a mid-afternoon buffet snack with wine! Score! Breakfast was also awesome with real espressos and made to order OMELETS! And tons of cured meats like coppa! How can you go wrong!
reviews.title: Lots of Good things.

aka: Albergo Marina Hotel Monterosso Al Mare
